moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6
comment: This is a sharp method of fighting for the initiative for Black. Allowing the endgame after 7...Qd7 8.Qxd7+ Nbxd7 is also possible although Black will be on the defensive for quite a while.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7
comment: Returning the bishop to its natural Queen's Indian square is necessary in order to develop my knight from b8 and to free my c-pawn. The loss of time involved is more than offset by the three White queen moves.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2
comment: Not 11.Bd3? Ba6 12.Nb5 c6 and Black wins. Premature is 11.b4 (trying to clamp down on the Black queenside and the Black c-pawn in particular) as White is still lagging in development, for example: 11...Nbd7 12.Be2 c5 13.dxc5 bxc5 14.b5 (If 14.Bxf6?! Bxf6 15.bxc5 Qa5 16.Rc1 Rfc8 and Black will regain the pawn on c5 with a clear queenside initiative.) 14...Qa5 (14...Nd5!?) 15.0-0 Nb6, with good counterplay.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1
comment: On the surface White's prospects seem quite promising as he has completed his development and centralized his rooks.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5
comment: Forcing the exchange of bishops on e7 and securing me control of the d5-square.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7
comment: If 16.Bf4 Nxf4 17.exf4 Qb6 18.d5 c4, with an edge for Black.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4
comment: A very ambitious approach which weakens the c3-square. More prudent was 18.Nd4.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4
comment: Black has secured control of the classic b7-g2 QID diagonal and in particular the e4-square.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3
comment: The optimism of youth, as doubling on the open d-file seems aggressive, but is really a blind alley. In addition, the rook on d3 interferes with the bishop on e2 attacking the Black a6-b5 pawn duo. It was time for White to pursue equality with 20.Rcc1 Rac8 21.Qb3 with the plan of a3-a4 to liquidate the queenside pawns.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5
comment: This move appeals to my sense of maximization, as thanks to my control of the d5-square, one bishop and one pawn (4 points) is able to neutralize two rooks (10 points) and attack one queen (9 points)!

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2
comment: White correctly attempts to exchange my influential knight. The attempt to contest the open c-file would leave Black slightly better: 22.Rc1 Rxc1+ 23.Qxc1 Qb7 24.Bd1 Rc8.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3
comment: This protects the e4-square and blunts the Black bishop on d5, while preparing to play e3-e4. However, it weakens the e3-point and the White second rank. 23.Bf3 would be better.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4
comment: Forcing the exchange of the White knight, after which the lone White bishop does not have positive prospects.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6
comment: This prevents any a3-a4 action by White, and his rooks still can't penetrate down the d-file in a meaningful manner.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6
comment: Making luft and hoping to lure White in. If 26...Rc6 27.Rc3.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6
comment: After 27.Rc3 Nd5! 28.Rxc8 Rxc8, Black has a meaningful initiative. If 27.e4 Rc6, with the idea of Rf8-c8 and Qe7-c7 with the initiative.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5
comment: This cuts the connection and co-ordination of the White rooks. White is now forced to accept the offer of the a6-pawn, after which his rook is out of play.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8
comment: Securing total control of the c-file. Instead 29...Rxe3 is premature, as after 30.Rc1 Black has surrendered the open c-file, while 30.Qf2 and White obtains some counterplay can also be considered. Note that 30.Bxb5? would be a mistake in view of 30...Nc3! 31.Qc1 (31.Rd7 Re1+ 32.Kf2 Qh4+ 33.g3 Qxh2+ wins for Black) 31...Nxd1 and Black is better.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8 30. e4 Ne3 31. Re1
comment: Not 31.Rd2? Rc1 32.Rf2 Qg5 33.h3 (33.Ra8 Qxg2+! 34.Rxg2 Rxf1 mate) 33...Nxf1 34.Rxf1 R8c2 and Black wins.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8 30. e4 Ne3 31. Re1 Nxf1
comment: Capturing the bishop weakens White further on the second rank and on g2 in particular.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8 30. e4 Ne3 31. Re1 Nxf1 32. Rxf1 Rc2 33. Qe5 Rd8
comment: Note how Black has secured the only two open files on the chessboard, which is ironic when you consider the disposition of the White rooks after 15.Rfd1.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8 30. e4 Ne3 31. Re1 Nxf1 32. Rxf1 Rc2 33. Qe5 Rd8 34. Qxb5
comment: Black wins quickly after 34.Rf2 Rd1+ 35.Rf1 Rdd2.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8 30. e4 Ne3 31. Re1 Nxf1 32. Rxf1 Rc2 33. Qe5 Rd8 34. Qxb5 Rdd2
comment: Double trouble.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8 30. e4 Ne3 31. Re1 Nxf1 32. Rxf1 Rc2 33. Qe5 Rd8 34. Qxb5 Rdd2 35. Qb8+ Kh7 36. Qg3 Qd7
comment: Preparing decisive penetration along the weakened d4-g1 diagonal and the White first rank. Also winning is 36...Qg5 37.Qxg5 hxg5 38.Rb1 Rxg2+ 39.Kf1 Rcf2+ 40.Ke1 Rxh2 and White is toast.

moves: 1. d4 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 b6 4. a3 Bb7 5. Nc3 d5 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qa4+ Bc6 8. Qb3 dxc4 9. Qxc4 O-O 10. e3 Bb7 11. Be2 a6 12. Rc1 Nbd7 13. O-O b5 14. Qa2 c5 15. Rfd1 Nd5 16. Bxe7 Qxe7 17. dxc5 Nxc5 18. b4 Nxc3 19. Rxc3 Ne4 20. Rcd3 Bd5 21. Qb2 Rac8 22. Nd2 Nd6 23. f3 Bc4 24. Nxc4 Nxc4 25. Qb3 Nb6 26. Bf1 h6 27. Rd6 Nd5 28. Rxa6 Rc3 29. Qb2 Rfc8 30. e4 Ne3 31. Re1 Nxf1 32. Rxf1 Rc2 33. Qe5 Rd8 34. Qxb5 Rdd2 35. Qb8+ Kh7 36. Qg3 Qd7 37. Ra5 Qd4+ 38. Kh1 Rd1
comment: White's back rank is overpowered.
